text: Geisinger Health is a Pennsylvania-based
integrated delivery network.

As part of our cloud journey,
one of the early things

we recognized is we needed a
partner to help us get there
so we could learn from them and others.
AWS truly became a great partner

early on in this project
for our organization.

We've built out a pretty
robust environment

and moved a lot of critical
workloads up there,
one of them being the EHR.

We've got an eye now on
data, data analytics.
We're also building out environments

so that we can handle both
product-based development

as well as traditional
IT and infrastructure.

One of the many benefits
that we've been able to see

through this project is being
able to give career paths

and also be able to provide
training for relevant skills,
and move folks that are eager to learn

and really out there wanting
to get their hands dirty
and build new things.

So the project allowed
us to really step back

and rethink the way that
we've designed IT at Geisinger
over the years and our infrastructure,
and it gave us an opportunity to start
with a blank sheet of paper.

And with that we were able
to do security and design,

we were able to completely
redesign the way
that we do fundamental networking,
and build out an architecture
that's now going to be scalable

and adaptable in the infrastructure
space for those needs.

And then also because of
the way that we've built out

the rest, we're also
able to spin up and do
product-based projects all within the same

kind of skillset with
the different accounts.
